para.sentence: J_{0}\left(z\right)=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos\left(z\sin\theta\right) \mathrm{d}\theta=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos\left(z\cos\theta\right) \mathrm{d}\theta, J_{n}\left(z\right)=\frac{1}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos\left(z\sin\theta-n\theta \right)\mathrm{d}\theta=\frac{i^{-n}}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}e^{iz\cos\theta}\cos \left(n\theta\right)\mathrm{d}\theta, if n\in\mathbb{Z}.

Y_{0}\left(z\right)=\frac{4}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\cos\left(z\cos \theta\right)\left(\gamma+\ln\left(2z{\sin^{2}}\theta\right)\right)\mathrm{d}\theta, where \gamma is Euler’s constant (§5.2(ii)).

In particular, J_{0}\left(x\right)=\frac{2}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\infty}\sin\left(x\cosh t\right) \mathrm{d}t, if x>0, //// Y_{0}\left(x\right)=-\frac{2}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\infty}\cos\left(x\cosh t\right) \mathrm{d}t, if x>0.
In (10.9.20) and (10.9.21) the integration paths are simple loop contours not enclosing t=-1.
Also, (t^{2}-1)^{\nu-\frac{1}{2}} is continuous on the path, and takes its principal value at the intersection with the interval (1,\infty).
c is any constant exceeding \max(\Re\nu,0).
For (10.9.22)–(10.9.25) and further integrals of this type see Paris and Kaminski (2001, pp. 114–116).

u)	hetaight)\mathrm{d}	heta, if \Re(\mu+
u)>-1.
For the function I_{\nu} see § 10.25(ii).

J_{\mu}\left(xight)J_{
u}\left(xight)= rac{1}{2\pi i}\int_{-i\infty}^{i \infty} rac{\Gamma\left(-tight)\Gamma\left(2t+\mu+

u+2t}}{\Gamma\left(t+\mu+1ight)\Gamma\left(t+

u+1ight)}\mathrm{d}t, if x>0, where the path of integration separates the poles of \Gamma\left(-tight) from those of \Gamma\left(2t+\mu+
u+1ight).
See Paris and Kaminski (2001, p. 116) for related results.
For the function K_{0} see §10.25(ii).

For collections of integral representations of Bessel and Hankel functions seeErdélyi et al. (1953b, §§7.3 and 7.12),Erdélyi et al. (1954a, pp. 43–48, 51–60, 99–105, 108–115, 123–124, 272–276, and 356–357),Gröbner and Hofreiter (1950, pp. 189–192),Marichev (1983, pp. 191–192 and 196–210),Magnus et al. (1966, §3.6), and Watson (1944, Chapter 6).
